He watched TV till late at a medium vol and snores when he slept. We could hear everything despite the concrete wall. All the noise travelled from the thin door which we had no control. We rang reception for room move and they simply said no room available! - tough. GM you need to have double door with good seals. 4. Room service menu looked very appetizing dont let it fool you. They offer late supper with plenty of choices however the only serve hot dogs, pizza and premade stuff. Due to jet lag we were awake and hungry at 4 am and couldnt eat greasy stuff all we wanted is fruit plate from the menu. Their excuse when we rang: we had emergency meeting this early morning? what sorta emergency that no one can cut simple fruits! 5. You could hear anybody who walk outside your room 6. mouldy bathroom and fault toilet 7. unfriendly concierge. It was raining on Friday. Asked if we can rent umbrella before we finished they abruptly interrupt me with buy only! no rent! guessing he's busy! GM need to look at staffing 8. Key card. Stupid rule that you allowed only 1 key/room. i'm not sure who's bright idea is this! GM you will definitely need to review this! my wife had to accompany me at late night to buy some water!. Conclusion >>>>> will definitely not come back. Go to tsim sha tsui/mongkok if i have to advise anybody. This hotel is located next to the fly over in old kowloon city and you can see the area is desperate for tourist, run down and smelly. Spend another $50 and dont waste time and energy you deserve value for your money! <<<<<<<<<

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Angel84India
Reviews.Content: Nice clean rooms though the rooms are very small. all basic utilities are provided in the rooms. the hotel is clean and well maintained. the breakfast spread is good with Asian and English spreads. room serivce is prompt. The staff is communicative. There is gym as well though i understand it is restricted to special guests. The concierge desk was helpful in directing us. The porter service is charged here.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and comfortable but expensive and a long way out”
Reviews.Author: HKT0urist
Reviews.Content: The room was fine - we had a twin and each bed was queen size. It was clean and tidy and relatively quiet. But it is quite expensive, particularly given its location (not near the MTR and a taxi ride). However taxis were quite cheap (about £6 to the harbour in Kowloon). We had the buffet and some drinks in the hotel and they were all very expensive. And even in the self service buffet and in the 'pub' you are charged an additional 10% service charge on top of your bill.

Reviews.Title: “Awful customer service”
Reviews.Author: B-HNL
Reviews.Content: I had read several reviews of this hotel before my holiday and I was slightly aprehensive of previous comments. Upon arrival I wanted to phone back to the UK, my mobile wouldn't connect so requested the reception for an IDD this cost HK$50 + HK$1.90 per minute. I decided to have a meal in the hotel "Coast Pub" consisting of a Salmon Fillet - when I cut into the fillet it was not just undercooked but UNcooked, I sent it back for a replacement. I requested my bedsheets to be replaced on three seperate days and there was no change, I requested to see the General Manager and all he offered was excuses for the cleaning staff NO apology to myself the paying customer. There was constant noise in the corridor every night from other guests (ie no sound insulation for the room). When I checked out the staff did not ask if my stay was pleasent. I will return to Hong Kong again in about 18 months but I must confess this is the worst Hotel experience I have ever encountered.

Reviews.Title: “NOT THAT gr8 CHOICE”
Reviews.Author: AkkshayJain
Reviews.Content: We had gone as a Family of 8 persons... When booking was done the pictures of the hotel seemed to be good. But on our visit it was not the same. The staff over there were friendly but the rules & system was not that friendly. On arrival i asked the bell boy to take luggage to our room, & I was turned down by saying " We would charge 4HKD for each baggage" (We had 17 bags, & so we lifted them by ourself to the rooms). Also we requested to give the rooms nearby, but our room were in 4 different corners. On entering the floor to open the door of outside the lift access card were required & then only we could enter where are rooms were located. They provided only 1 Key to room, that means if we have to move out of the room we both have to move out or else i have to call the other person & then he will give access. I Found this a foolish system. Also, the rooms keys were plain white card, No name of the Hotel, etc This created a bad impression in our minds. The food & Decor of the Hotel was good. Negative point The Hotel was not equipped with Swimming Pool Plus point, it was very near to all the shopping malls & markets. Moral: Hotel was not good, location was good, price was good.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal”
Reviews.Author: 220v
Reviews.Content: Great price for Hong Kong! The hotel is very nice, lare room and great service. Not central, maybe 20 min bus to downtown, easy to take the bus because the bus-stop is named after the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel but away from the main areas”
Reviews.Author: mih1954
Reviews.Content: Good value hotel when booked through a broker. Both of our rooms had 2 double beds. Eateries were a disappointment and poor value for the money. One of the nearest tube station was Diamond Hill , but you still needed a cheap taxi to the hotel. If you don't mind being away from the centre and want a quiet , clean place to stay then I would recommend this hotel but dine out.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: computer48
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely hotel. Clean and the staff is so helpful. Kelly has been so nice she is so patient with us Americans who do not speak the language. I love being in Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Regal iClub looks great”
Reviews.Author: Fretraveller_10
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Regal Oriental Hotel for 3Nights. Great value. I stayed at 3/f, it gives you access to the Regal iclub Lounge which has 3 PCs, a bunch of magazines and books, TV, and some light refreshments. I enjoyed reaching this lounge to grab a fruit juice or two and chat with others. Check-in and Check-out was fast and with no hassle. Breakfast is included in my rate. Nearby you can find restaurants of different cuisine such as Thai food, indian food, typical Hong Kong snacks. You can get good advise from staff there.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice - value for money”
Reviews.Author: Samliketravel
Reviews.Content: not expensive, but trurly good value, room was clean and tidy, room maid are very cheerful and helpful. Although not near to subway train, buses, mini bus and taxi are not difficult to find HK is a small place and easily access. also many asian food outlets around and it was no boring. one last thing, staff there were very informative and can advise on everythings

Reviews.Title: “non recommend hotel - regal Oriental”
Reviews.Author: DAVEVE1191
Reviews.Content: Hotel is located in Kowloon City, when I get in the Hotel, that's make my feel uncomfortable, In case i am a traveler and carrying thousand of luggage with me, but the bell boy Nick just stand like a tree and not welling help me till i call for help. After I get to the reception counter, lady are wearing smile through the check-in process. but the check in process it take for too long time, must have many rooms to improve. About the room 1.lighting is too dim 2. The "King Bed" is in single bed size 3. View is terrible

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel with great ambiance”
Reviews.Author: ardeshir46
Reviews.Content: Hotel in it self looks majestic with a grand entrance . It looks stunning at night as it is all lighted up and it looks just great! Location is good to all shopping areas and restaurants but it is far from the main downtown area.Rooms are very spacious with all modern amenities.Good room service also.Staff are very polite and go out of the wat to help you out. The hotel lobby is what I liked the best as it was roomy with different types of furniture with different shapes. Great food with a huge selection of food.Quality of food was exceoptinally good. A great hotel to stay and enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Location is a negative...but value for money”
Reviews.Author: rahulzz1983
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel in May for 4 days. Althought the hotel is not close to MTR or major tourist attractions, it is easily accessibly using bus 25M to Kowloon Tong MTR....and where most tourist locations are close to Central Hong Kong or Tsim Tsa Sui, travelling upto Central is just 20 mins MTR ride. Size of the room was decent compared to similar priced hotel in any other location closer to Central HK. One problem I faced is the availability of vegeteriaan food. Not much vegeterian food options on the menu but there is an Indian restaurant at walking distance from the hotel. All in all....good value for money....

Reviews.Title: “Bad Location and run down hotel”
Reviews.Author: madsethi
Reviews.Content: We were in Hong Kong for couple of days in April 2010 and were booked at the Regal Oriental Hotel in Kowloon. We had booked for deluxe room. On check in we were taken to a room on the 3rd floor and got the shock of our lives. We have travelled all over the world extensively, but have NEVER ever seen a room like one. The room was literally 8 feet by 6 feet or so with the bed stuck next to a small window and a tiny little attached bath! Was this a deluxe room??? We left the room and went down to the reception and confronted the girl there regarding what we had paid for and what we were getting...To cut a long story short we finally got a room on the 13 F - and a very nice one at that! But not after the hotel had tried to palm off a cubby hole to us. The location of the hotel was bad - nowhere near a metro station - had to take taxi or a bus to get to the nearest one! Staff was indiffrent, the buffet breakfast was mediocre. Will we ever stay there again or recommend it to anyone? I don't think so!

Reviews.Title: “terrible stay 3 days 2 night”
Reviews.Author: kl0900
Reviews.Content: i'm student, in 23 JUN-25, the hotel let us later check in( after 4-5pm). and my friend stay other room like check out room, not clean room. my stay room look very clean, but in the bed that is terrible for me, the bed inside have bedbug, let me 30 bite in my body, firstly i think is mosquito, my friends told me may be the bed problem, because the crowded of bite. i never want try again this hotel.... 我最近才住过那酒店··住的4楼·哪里房间不干净，有些 房间有臭虫，我住了2天··全身30多个包··刚开始我以为 是蚊子，结果有些房间 和我一样，咬的包是在一起的，我的右脚 就有20多个。。

Reviews.Title: “awesome!”
Reviews.Author: DaxIbero
Reviews.Content: one of the best rates in town. . .i got to choose my room with a great view of the old airport. . .it's location is perfect for travelers who wish to sink their teeth into just about anything. . .

Reviews.Title: “Fair hotel- would probably stay again”
Reviews.Author: bLueMnM
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights and 4 days. I would give it a 3 star rating. Positives: Room was clean. The concierge was friendly, helpful and understood English very well. Negatives: Small rooms, probably because of the space issues in HK. I found the receptionist to be very unfriendly. Far from the airport (about 45-1 hr ride to the airport). No free internet. Very expensive. Tip: The 25 bus is right outside the hotel and will take you to the Kowloon MTR station (15-20 minute ride for about 5HK dollars - VERY cheap). From the MTR station you can literally go anywhere. It's quick, efficient, easy to learn, and much cheaper than taxi. It's dirt cheap. If you are coming from the airport, I would book a shuttle with the hotel. Do not take a taxi (expensive) or go by public transportation - too much of a hassle to drag your luggage. Also, walk around outside the hotel. There is a nearby shopping mall which you can buy good gifts, probably at a cheaper price than haggling at the night markets.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: devonsb
Reviews.Content: I must say we were very impressed with the hotel and room interiors. However for someone who wants to go with children; i must warn you that the rooms have glass walls in their bathroom which make it a little inconvenient with family. Rooms are decently spacious. Our room did not have any view though. Hotel was conveniently placed from most of the shopping destinations in kowloon. overall happy with our stay and would recommend this to all.

Reviews.Title: “Interesting hotel”
Reviews.Author: NbyNWalsall
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights as our flight was cancelled and our previous hotel priced themselves way out of the market, so for £50 pn we got the Regal Oriental. In some ways it had it's hayday as the old Kai Tak airport hotel and now seems stranded, far from the centre. The room was big, clean, a little 1970's but ok, the kids preferred it to the Novotel where we had previously stayed. The concierge staff were helpful as were the business centre as i was trying to book flights out of HK, at a price of course. We had breakfast at a nearby Mcdonalds and there were plenty of local restaurants, particularly Thai, the locality never felt unsafe or oppressive, just really vibrant. We got around by taxi, about £4-5 to TST which was reasonable as six of us crammed in. The nearby Kowloon City Park is excellent, great for the kids. The hotel shuttle bus was useful to get to the airport without the hassle of taxis or the Airport Express. Probably won't stay here again but theres really only the location against it.

Reviews.Title: “Clean Hotel... Not central but great staff”
Reviews.Author: Cotai_Traveller
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel for a whole week... I was taking some exams at a close by examinations centre...and for this reason decided to stay in the Kai Tak area. First note that the hotel is right next to a high way,,, so if you are staying at a room facing the highway be prepared for a noisy night... For this reason, have asked to change the room and the staff, who was very kind (unlike HK style) got me an upgrade to another room... The hotel overall is good... not great... but since for HK it is considered cheap... i would recommend for those who are staying in the kowloon area... the trip to Central would take around a 10 minutes walk to the MTR station and then 30 minutes by MTR.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ellie654
Reviews.Content: Ignore the negative reviews. If booked through an agent, this hotel is very good value for money. It's very clean and the rooms are well equipped with free tea and coffee and a mini bar. Others have mentioned that it's not in central Kowloon. As a 19 year old girl travelling for the first time i did not once feel threatened in the area despite being in the minority as a westerner. Also there is a MTR station about 15 minutes walk from the hotel which can take you to Hong Kong Island for about a pound. Also, the hotel runs a courtesy shuttle bus to and from the airport and also takes trips to the centre and to disney land. Overall, a very good hotel which i would reccomend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Good standard and friendly service”
Reviews.Author: LondonSenorita
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is in Kowloon which is about 20 mins by taxi to most places about HK$70. The area is the old airport which is being rebuilt into a port. Lots of places to eat and shop in the vicinity of the hotel and the number 6 bus outside takes you to Ladies Market (MongKok) and to the Star Ferry terminal. Worth upgrading to a premium room with breakfast included. Restaurants in the hotel are pricey but the cafe in the basement has a good selection. No pool or gym. I booked the tourist excurtions with the concierge and well worth it for a quick visit to this city. Would not recommend the night cruise with lights -- better in Shanghai. Visit the old gardens short walk from hotel, really tranquil.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: savindrasingh
Reviews.Content: I went there with my colleagues for bussiness trip. We stayed there for 15 days. I found the hotel staff very professional. Room service was excellent. Rooms were very clean and tidy. Restaurant have all the menu options available starting from western, Indian, and chineese. Food quality was very excellent. The person cooking Indian food was a Punjabi person from Indian origin and was a very good cook. The hotel have a very good transportation service available. They also provide mini bus service for the groups.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Place”
Reviews.Author: josh4amit
Reviews.Content: Hotel Regal Oriental is a great place in Hong Kong. Apart from its location, which is quite far from the main city and its attractions, one will admire everything about the hotel. The Hotel has its own Charisma and the staff is quite co-operative as well. The size of the rooms are also decent. Added attraction is a Indian Restaurant very nearby. The worst part of the Hotel is that it is not at a central location and a little far from the City attractions like Avenue of the Stars, Disney, etc. The food is below average and not recommended for Vegetarians like us. Even the buffet breakfast is not worth while. Overall, it is a decent place to stay if the transportation and meals are managed properly.

Reviews.Title: “If this is all you can afford, stay home.”
Reviews.Author: cjoshm
Reviews.Content: It's very difficult to determine which is worse: the location, the service, or the rooms. This place is a dump, and the people who work there do nothing to improve the experience. I've stayed in every kind of hotel around the world, and this is the worst.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: dimsum31
Reviews.Content: Regal Oriental Hong Kong is the old Kai Tak Airport Hotel; facing a huge unused piece of land which used to be the old Hong Kong airport. The hotel itself underwent a recent refurbishment and has decent room sizes (much better than most HKK hotels). Room windows are double glazed and therefore very quite. Can't really confirm other readers negative comments about poor English of staff and low service standard. I thought the front desk staff was very friendly with a good command of English. The location is not bad, just 5 minutes by minibus to Kowloon Tong MTR or by bus 20 min to the star ferry.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Staff”
Reviews.Author: TravellingTarun
Reviews.Content: In Hongkong English speaking is an issue with majority of the locals, they can not speak or understand it. Moreover the receptionist of this hotel when told this got rude and replied "I lend inklis in inland". The reception staff including this boy and the girls are really a pain as a customer support. The other staffs in the front office are also in the same league. Its a shame for a cosmopolitan city this star rated hotel is recruiting bad apples, which definitely spoils the taste. The girls sitting in the front ofice on the 3rd floor are pathetically un-courteous. They have yet to learn the skill to be polite and helpful to the customers.

Reviews.Title: “A new lease of life for a classic hotel”
Reviews.Author: sweetyoungthing
Reviews.Content: Twenty years ago this was The Hotel and once the new wharf area is in operation it will thrive again. Lots of work has been done in the cafe/restaurant area and 3rd floor and new rooms are updated all the time. After several weeks in Africa I was looking for the white fluffy towels and comfy bed, a real shower and all the extras.........I wasn't disappointed. This is great value for money. Some of the room may be small (you can upgrade to the 6th floor) but they have everything you need for a relaxing break. It's in Kowloon so you need to take a little bus (HK$3) to Wong Tai Sin shops/temple then board the train to Central (HK$11). Have a drink in the 14th floor bar and watch the traffic...see how many privately owned cars you can spot........in a city of 8 million people the have there transport worked out beautifully.

Reviews.Title: “good room size”
Reviews.Author: bhavna4v1
Reviews.Content: Good sized rooms, very comfy beds. service was not so bad.. most of them didn't understand english though. but the hotel was well decorated.

Reviews.Title: “In the middle of nowhere, Overpriced”
Reviews.Author: fatchance1234
Reviews.Content: I got this hotel in a Wotif Mystery deal. My first surprise was that it's in the middle of nowhere to the east of the actual downtown area. You need to take a bus or taxi just to get to the actual city. One of the amenities listed was free broadband access, when I got to the hotel they did not have this for my room. Even though it clearly stated that it did. I was forced to upgrade to a premium room 130$ more. Rip off, this hotel is not worth it at all. STAY AWAY. Also something smells funny in this room, I am still trying to look for it now.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, helpful staff...what more can you ask for!!!”
Reviews.Author: NirvanaPerth_WA
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at the Regal Oriental hotel, the rooms were a good size by Hong Kong standards and were very well fit-out. The staff were extremely helpful and polite. I would recommend the restaurants as well, the food at Cafe Neo's buffets was very good and special mention has to be made of their chinese restaurant the Regal Seafood restaurant as the food there was to die for, especially the chef's special- beef and asparagus in wasabi sauce!!!!!YUM!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “A Generally Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Pinktulip75
Reviews.Content: The concierge, reservation service and cleaning staff were generally good overall, and their exchange rate is definitely better than having your money exchanged at the Australian Airport. Our only little whinge about their room itself is that they don't provide enough sugar for coffee nor do they provide an iron/ironing board for use. We would've liked to have been given the option of a smoking or non-smoking room to begin with so we didn't have to ask to be transferred. But once we got our non-smoking room, we were very happy. Although the hotel location is a little far away from the main happenings of the city, you only need to take 20 min bus trip (Bus Nos. 1A or 9) to travel directly to Tsim Sha Tsui, where all the major shopping centres and eateries are. But definitely check out the Mongkok markets for discounted bags, jeweleries and clothes, which is only 15 minutes away from the hotel using the same bus route. Also, ladies...after all that shopping, you're going to need a very relaxing foot massage, and I highly recommend going to the one directly opposite the hotel - its a must!

Reviews.Title: “Wow Experiance”
Reviews.Author: MiSola
Reviews.Content: I don't usually review hotels, but this one is exceptional. 1st night in Kowloon was a wash at a well known hotel in a popular area of Kowloon. Luckily, I found this hotel and decided to stay in Kowloon a few more days. Booked on-line for about 340 HK, when I arrived, the staff was actually smiling, polite and welcoming. For no apparent reason, I was upgraded into a suite 4x the size of the room in the other hotel. Then offered a package that included unlimited in-room internet, free breakfast (good , fresh hot, food) etc, for Less then I booked the room for on-line. Maids are well trained and cheerful, then a manager checks the room afterward. She noticed a loose shower knob and soon a maintenance man had it fixed. So it takes a few minutes to get to Mon Kok etc. Taxi's servicing this hotel are honest and cheap, quick and the walk around here is nice, with the walled city park is a block over. I'm thrilled there aren't masses of cars and people right outside the entrance. Value, Value, Value. That's my experience here.

Reviews.Title: “Good Rooms, Bad Location !!!”
Reviews.Author: shalink01
Reviews.Content: We were on a family holiday with a child of 3 years. The rooms are good value for the money but then again the location is really sad, there's absolutely nothing close by, its actually in the middle of nowhere !! The rooms are really neat and clean and so is the bathroom with all basic amenities. Excellent value for money. The sightseeing's and nightlife are way too far.... its actually the other side of Kowloon and far from tshim sha sui !!! Avoid this hotel of your looking for convenient access to major areas. At easily walking distance of 15 mins you will find one Indian Restaurant, A Good Thai Restaurant and a Seven Eleven store for convenience.

Reviews.Title: “Very satisfied, will stay here again....”
Reviews.Author: PINAY09
Reviews.Content: All the negative reviews I've read were put to rest. We had a grand time at the Regal Oriental Hotel. I booked for 2 rooms (triple sharing and twin sharing). The rooms are beautiful, modern, spacious, clean. The bathroom has a bath tub. The hotel staff are friendly and helpful. We were pleasantly surprised as we did not expect the rooms as well as the hotel itself to be this beautiful. By the way, we booked our hotel thru Octopus Travel. We plan to go back to Hongkong in the future and we will definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Budget Hotel - Close to Flea Market and Fake Market”
Reviews.Author: siddharthsahi
Reviews.Content: Regal Oriental is a average 3* hotel with no frills. The Hotel staff is courteous at the reception but room service is sad. Food is highly overpriced. Markets like Nathan street are 20 mins drive away. Nathan street is close to the electronic & fake market for purses. Negative point about hotel: No water in room. Each 300 ml bottle costs 25 HKD!!! So when thirsty go to the vending machine outside the hotel and take water for 6 HKD. remember to carry change

Reviews.Title: “fine for a transit stay”
Reviews.Author: gaurav_barjatya
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located centrally in Kowloon .. the rooms were decent but the service was not up to the mark .. basic thing like water was not available in the room and you could buy a bottle for $ 25 !! The plus point is that the shopping markets are not very far from here . . overall just about fine for people in transit and want to stay for a night . .

Reviews.Title: “Gone with the days”
Reviews.Author: QCInspector
Reviews.Content: I was rather hesitant when I made my reservation with Regal Oriental. Frankly, being a seasoned traveller, I know I should not trust everything on the hotel's website... the clean and spacious room... the modern design. Unfortunately, I was proven right when I checked into Regal Oriental Hong Kong. First, if you think you are going to get one of those rooms that were shown on the website... think again... not unless you are checked into the Executive floor on the third level (OMG! Which hotel has its executive rooms on third floor???). Least did I expect when I asked for a high-floor room what I've got is a themed Chinese decor room. I was shocked! The room resembled a Chinese restaurant in the 1980's. For one moment, I thought I was the star of a chinese porn movie! Having got used to clean and well-design hotel rooms, this really topped the list for being the worst hotel. The furniture was old and worn out. And I had so many issues with the bed! Don't expect a good night sleep if you are sharing the bed. I was woken up whenever my partner made a slight move. The bed is not firm at all! The bathroom is worse. The fixtures are old, tiles are old and worn. The toiletries are not even comparable to that of a 4-star hotel! The towels??? Torn and old. I was told by the receptionist that all the rooms were renovated (since when???). Other than the modern rooms at level 3 (the so called executive floor), the rest of the rooms are themed Chinese or Arabian... hmmm. If you are into kinky rooms, then this Regal Oriental is definitely a good choice for you. The only good thing about the hotel is the gym. Although I didn't use it, I did have a look at it. I must say that the gym is much better than what I've expected. It's small but it has the basic equipments and most importantly, it's clean and modern. The hotel is definitely out of any action. But taxis are easily available. I took a cab to the nearest MTR station (about HK$40) and transferred to the subway whenever I needed to go to Hong Kong island. But if you are looking for action and fun, then this hotel is definitely not your choice. It's too out of the way. On the whole, this hotel is good for the budget conscious crowd. I would say... it's great for backpackers. I'm not going to return to the hotel... that's for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Intriguing en-suite”
Reviews.Author: Cangothere
Reviews.Content: My husband was in Hong Kong for 18 months when he did his National Service many years ago so this was a nostalgic visit. We had a lovely room on 3rd floor which had obviously recently been refurbished. The en-suite was all glass which we found very novel and the shower was excellent. Coffee/tea making facilities were provided which is quite unusual in a foreign hotel. We found the staff helpful and the breakfast catered for every nationality and was more than adequate. The surrounding district is a bit run down but there are lots of inexpensive authentic restaurants and the busses are cheap and frequent. We got the A22 bus from the airport as our pre-booked transfer did not turn up, I think it cost 69HKD each and the stop is just round the corner from the hotel. Senior citizens get to travel free on the Star Ferry and there are quite a lot of other concessions if you are an OAP so don't forget to ask. We had lovely weather and had a terrific trip especially as we caught the end of Chinese New Year. (If you cant find the hairdryer it is in the drawer in the en-suite.)

Reviews.Title: “Quite nice but a bit off.”
Reviews.Author: Mats_Stockholm
Reviews.Content: This hotel is quite nice and feels fresh. Our room was rather newly renovaited. We got a room on the 14th floor with a view ower the old airport and could see a little of the harborough. Comfortable beds, coffeemaking facilities, flat TV, sitting area and a beautiful chaineese dekoration at the wall ower the bed. The staff werer very friendly and helpful. Mabye the reception isn´t so great, feels a bit streange. The problem with this hotel is the location. It´s a bit way out and a bit too far from the city. We took the local doubbledecker bus just outside the hotel. It din´t even cost a dollar. It took a while to get down to the city of Cowlon but on the other hand we got a nice sightseeing tour. Around the hotel you find a lot of genuin small local restaurants, small shops and also a quite interesting local marcet. The hotel is quite alright but the location is not. Mats and Lasse, Sweden

Reviews.Title: “Can be good value if all you need is a clean room”
Reviews.Author: L00ps
Reviews.Content: I lived in HK until my early teens so I remember this hotel, which is located right next to the old Kai Tak Airport. Then, it was a classy 4 star joint. Some 15 or so years later, it has not changed that much. The lobby is renovated but the room decor is exactly the same! But don't get me wrong, I was on a personal visit and only needed a clean, decent room so for the price I paid, which was inclusive of airfare, the Regal Oriental worked out pretty well. I didn't expect frills and did not find any. It would have been better, though, if more attention is paid to the decorative conditions in the bathroom. The bath tap and showerhead have seen better days. Everything worked, though. Seals do need to be scraped out and redone. In terms of transport links, the buses are very good though of course only if you know how they work! The A22 Cityflyer takes you directly from the airport to right outside the hotel and costs far less than the Airport Express. There are direct buses outside the hotel by Sung Wong Toi bus stop (cross the road by subway) which take you to TST, Jordan, and Central (9, 11 and 101/111). For the budget conscious traveller, it would be possible to do lots of homework beforehand online and on arrival at HK International Airport, buy an Octopus Card from Airport Express's customer service desk and put money on it and off you go! The Octopus Card is used on all public transport as well as for small purchases from snack machines and such like so it is worth getting. I would mention that the hotel is in the "Kowloon City" district as in the old "walled city" which was grazed down. There is a park nearby which, I believe, has a small museum about the walled city as it then was.

Reviews.Title: “Inconsistent”
Reviews.Author: Miffy123
Reviews.Content: Not all the rooms in the hotel have undergone renovation, so beware when booking a Run of House room from travel agent. Stayed here on two separate occasions, and the quality of the rooms varied significantly. The level 11 room was spacious, freshly refurbished, with comfortable beds and a LCD TV. The level 6 room was spacious but old, with hard beds, worn-out furniture, stained carpets and a mouldy smell. For both rooms, the bathroom was dated and quality of the towels ranged from fluffy to well-worn. We were also shown a newly renovated twin room on level 3 with contemporary furnishings and a modern glass bathroom, but the size of the room was extremely tiny. Service was also inconsistent, ranging from extremely helpful & polite staff to apathetic & gloomy-faced receptionists. The hotel is still undergoing renovations, and the view from the hotel rooms were of bamboo scaffolding and the concrete wasteland of the old HK airport. Location-wise, the hotel is not in a touristy area and is not close to a MTR (subway) station. However, outside the hotel there is a taxi stand (reasonable price, but not for peak hour traffic), as well as a mini-bus station (ask receptionist to change your notes to coins as the bus only accepts exact fare). Airport shuttle bus provided by the hotel was very useful.

Reviews.Title: “Great Inexpensive Hotel”
Reviews.Author: hatster31
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel if you are looking for something inexpensive and am willing to travel via bus to places. This used to be a solid hotel back when the HK airport was in Chep Lak Kok. I was able to book a room for USD $75 a night via gtahotels.com, and there were many other websites that had the rooms under USD $100. The room and hotel are very clean. However, do not expect too much luxury. The hotel is also undergoing outside renovation on the outside walls, so there is not much of a view. The room is very quiet because of the double pane windows, so you hear no street noises. To travel around, there were always a lot of taxis outside the hotel. You can also take the 25M bus to Kowloon Tong MTR station. The stop is right outside the hotel, and you can ride it all the way to the end stop. Just make sure you get exact change or an Octopus card. You can also ride the green mini bus to Mong Kok. When you get off at the end station, walk to the end of the street and turn right and there is the Mong Kok MTR station. There are also multiple buses within a 3 minute walk. Just ask the front desk. The bus has route info, so you can see exactly where the bus goes and where to get off. So, this is a convenient location if you know where you are going. There are also many restaurants close by, but not too many with English menus or English speaking staff.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't like the view form my window”
Reviews.Author: Sudeepto
Reviews.Content: The room was ok but very congested. The view from my window was terrible as there was scaffolding all around because of some construction going on at the hotel. The service was terribly slow. I had to call Housekeeping twice and wait for more than an hour to get an adapter attachment for plugging in my laptop. The worst is, most of the Housekeeping staff who came didnt understand English so whatever I use to say or ask, they will ask me to phone the Reception. The buffet breakfast (that was complimentary) was most boring. I stayed for 3 days there and I ended up almost bored with the same breakfast laid (without any variations) every day in the morning. The location is very far from the main tourist places & shopping areas. So, if you are going to Hong Kong as tourist and shopping, then Regal Oriental is definitely not your best choice.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: cookie8
Reviews.Content: We were booked into this hotel as an add-on to a tour of China. We checked it's website & it seemed fine apart from being outside the main Hong Kong attractions. There was some refurbishment happening when we arrived, lots of noise & dust, but the major disappointment was the room. Our room 347 was a furnished corridor! The room was approx 8 feet in width with 2 single beds squashed up at the end of the room. It had the feel of a room in a university hall of residence. We were there for 2 nights, our room wasn't made up after the first night either. Due to the builders we had to keep the curtains drawn as they were wandering about on the scaffolding outside the window. There are much better hotels to choose from in Hong Kong so my advice is steer clear of this one.

Reviews.Title: “nice affordable 3 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: tqlagold
Reviews.Content: I booked the hotel thru HKHA (Hong Kong Hotel Association) at the airport. They offered a really good rate including airport transfer (to the hotel and to the airport). The bus ride to the hotel from the airpot took only 45 minutes, but going to the airport from the hotel took about 1.5 hours because we stopped at another Regal hotel to pick up more people. But overall, the complimentary airport transfer is great. The location is not so great, it takes one bus ride and MTR rides to get to go tourist attractions (TST, hong kong island, etc). The bus ride is about 15-20 minutes, and MTR takes a second. For 4 days I was there, i bought a HKD150 octopus card, and still have HKD30 left. And I take MTR everywhere (including Tung Chung to go to Big Buddha), I didn't even ride on a taxi at all while I was there. The room is spacious. We actually got a sitting area. The mattress is hard, but I think it's normal in HK. We got a view of the Prince Edward Road from 12th floor. Concierge staff is very helpful, reception staff are friendly. They charge HKD50 for half hour internet use on 3rd floor, not bad. There are a lot of thai and vietnamese restaurants around the corner. The neighborhood seems pretty safe to walk around at night. We were jetlagged, so we walked to 24 hour McDonalds at 4am. The only bad thing is, the hotel doesn't have a pool. I had never stayed at a hotel with no pool. It rained a lot when we were there, and an indoor pool would be great when we're stuck in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “good value (because of the area)”
Reviews.Author: Arthawk
Reviews.Content: Located in Kowloon City (not Kowloon Tong), and trade has passed on with airport relocation. It really is a long way from the HK action. Other than the small historic Walled City Park and the multitude of Thai and Chinese restaurants in the little enclave around the corner, there's nothing to see or do here. The upside of that is, as soon as you leave the hotel on foot you are unlikely to run into any other tourists. It's a working class HK neighbourhood which can be fascinating until you realise that the way people hang their washing out is pretty much the same all over the world. But if you've been to HK many times and always stayed in tourist-infested Central or Tsim Sha Tsui, it's an interesting experience for a couple of nights.

Reviews.Title: “chinese logica”
Reviews.Author: Cats9000
Reviews.Content: When arriving it has a regular three star entrance, the service is a bit chaotic, sometimes they open the door for you, sometimes they just stand there. They let you carry the luggage inside, after they take it to the bell desk. Check-in was not heartwarming. After check-in nobody was there to take our luggage up, so we unlocked it from the wire they put around our suitcases and carried them ourselves. Surprisingly while the hotel is mainly in old brown classic Chinese decor, the third floor-the Regal I-club where we stayed, was ultramodern and design, the rooms were equipped with a transparent wall-bath room and a big mirror on the ceiling that gave a bit of a love hotel impression. The Regal I-club has its own breakfast area at the same floor with a service counter, but the breakfast downstairs offers more choices. It's located close to bus stops, but rather far from the subway station. Good and cheap restaurants are on walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “The worth hotel !”
Reviews.Author: Jambs39Beijing
Reviews.Content: The good point first : None The bad point : Room small (even when I was student without a peny my room was much bigger) Basically, there is place for the bed, 1 small lugage and...that's it. Transfert from the airport to the hotel : stopped at 11:00 pm...noone informed us, even if we have warned on our late arrival... Transfert from the hotel to airport : 2 h with a ... bus, instead of 30 mn with a car Basically I would not recommand at all this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Regal Oriental Cheap and Convienent”
Reviews.Author: Abdul_R
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in Kowloon Tong where the old Airport and use to be the closest to the airport. Ok now for no one whom has been to Hong Kong I have stayed at this hotel twice already this year. The hotel is about 15 minutes cab ride from Kowloon Tong Metro station which is about $30 HKD during rush hour. (There is also a massive shopping mall attached to the station) If you wanted to you could always use the public light bus which costs $4.00 HKD either cash or Octopus (equivalent to a Oyster card used on London transport) normally it is bus number 25M when you come out of the hotel and turn left that you would one to catch to Kowloon Tong plus you can’t miss the stop on the 25M as it is the last stop on the bus. Myself and a college was there for business and leisure the area we thought was very safe as we would be out at 3.00 o’clock in the morning. A cab fair from Lan Kwai Fong which is the club district for Hong Kong and which is on Hong Kong Island is about $100 HKD but make sure to state Regal Oriental old airport hotel as they have a tendency to go to the Regal riverside hotel. The hotel for its price is brilliant and I personally thought it was perfect to move around the whole of Hong Kong. The hotel was brilliant you couldn’t go wrong soon as you land at the airport there are direct connections via there hotel shuttle bus to the hotel the shuttle bus also servers Disney Land Hong Kong. The staff at the hotel are brilliant they have are very proficient in English rooms are extremely clean the view is brilliant. The rooms are modern and have a very elegant feeling and we where staying in a deluxe room the bathroom was amazing with a marble effect wash basin shelf with a massive mirror and hair dryer the room we where staying in also was equipped with a mini bar and a safe . I would say after having a look at the business rooms the deluxe is a lot better. There is access to a Wifi internet connection in all the rooms at a charge of $350 HKD for 3 days and about $100 HKD for 24hrs. They have a small business centre as well which offers printing, fax, scanning and photocopying the rates are reasonable. I would recommend this hotel to anyone without hesitation. The Hotel is also situated very close to the Hong Kong Baptist University Hospital which has an Accident & Emergency department.

Reviews.Title: “Too far out from anything”
Reviews.Author: FamilyOnVacati0n
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not convenient from anywhere of interest to a foreign tourist. It is NOT near an MRT (subway station) and there is NO easy bus lines to an MRT station. You either have to take a taxi OR if you are chinese and adventurous you can be like a local and flag down the "right" green mini-bus from the side of the street (2 blocks from the hotel, NO station, the destination sign in chinese) to take you to the nearest MRT station (Wong Tai Sin station). The hotel itself looks nice but the rooms, although VERY nice, are very old. May be they are going for the "retro" look. I ate at the roof top restaurant/bar (very nice and EXCELLENT night view) but, I was the ONLY guest the whole time I was there. I just get the feeling that this hotel was once great but now it is "left behind" by the changing time. I loved the bed and the bedding, it has one of the best blankets and pillows that I have had in a 3 or 4 star hotel. The flat panel TV is good too. The bathroom is nice. This hotel was one of the best priced 3 star that I found for November. In summary, the accommodation is GREAT but the location is terrible for a tourist.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, but inconvieniently located.”
Reviews.Author: APGUK
Reviews.Content: Good sized room (upgraded for small fee). Staff very friendly, didn't eat in the evening, but the breakfast was good. The only bad thing about this place is the location - don't stay here if you need to pop back throughout the day, as it's a 20 minute (very cheap £3.50 / HK$50) taxi down to the Star Ferry. If you're going to be out all day and not need to pop back to your room, then this is a pretty good choice. They had a small gym and a free 3 PC internet room, but didn't use either.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff, Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ChinaBest
Reviews.Content: The Staff here were fantastic, very attentive and caring. we became members of the Regal Club and it made a difference to our stay for sure. The hotel weekend buffet was terrific. Very clean hotel, and close to downtown via short bus ride (10 mins). Plus the buses run very frequently so you never have to wait more than a couple of minutes until the next one. We would definately stay here again when we are next in Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Are all rooms SO small?”
Reviews.Author: isiaVienna
Reviews.Content: We have booked for one night only for 3 persons. The room was really VERY small. Normally it should be the room for 2 persons not for 3 ! One night for arrival after midnight and depart before breakfast (flight very early) - is ok, but not for longer stay. Location ok. Room quiet. Staff very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel for the $$ but not convenient for tourist”
Reviews.Author: DougMCincinnati
Reviews.Content: This hotel must have been one of the closest and most disired hotels for the old HK airport, literally overlooking it. The staff was friendly and helpful, very much making you feel like a valued customer. Our room was clean and comfortable. The breakfast buffet was good. Our rate was terrific we thought for HK but now we know why. It takes 30 minutes to get to the Harbor area from the hotel with good traffic. If you're willing to sacrifice your time to save some money then I do not think you will be disappointed. Watch out the upgrade selling when you check in. The only one we took was free airport transportation combined with the breakfast buffet. My advise is to call them directly to make your reservation and get them to include it up front for their usual price if possible.

Reviews.Title: “What a memorable vacation it was...”
Reviews.Author: ChrissyAC
Reviews.Content: I recently went to visit Hongkong with my family and it was our very first trip to other countries. We got to stay for 5 days in the Regal Oriental Hotel. And I have to say that all of the hotel staff were very polite & helpful. Especially since we didn't have an agency to assist us with our trip. Our trips to Hongkong's tourist destinations would not have been made possible if not for the assistance by the hotel staff. We were able to visit Kowloon Hotel & Holiday Hotel. And frankly speaking, I prefer the Regal Oriental Hotel better because of its cozy atmosphere in the hotel lobby. The room that we got had 3 beds. The space was quite adequate since there were only 3 of us. We have brought and eaten food inside our rooms and we have never seen any insect crawling. Our room was kept well & tidy by the hotel maids every morning. So by the time we return to the hotel in the evening, it makes it easier for us to lay down immediately and sleep. One flaw of the hotel is their water system. During our entire stay, they were doing some maintenance & repairs to it. It didn't affect us though since we are already gone by the time they cut-off the water. And we have already arrived by the time the water system is being resumed to normal operation. One important thing is that they never fail to give out announcements to all hotel guests about the water interruptions.

Reviews.Title: “Goodbye Regal Oriental”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Regal Oriental used to be the renowned 4-star Airport Hotel in Hong Kong, that's why before I move in, I don't have any doubt on its quality. Unfortunately, the hotel's golden days have gone, following the removal of Kai Tak International Airport to ChapLapKok...... 1. The room size is alright, not small at all as compared to many other 4-star hotels in HK, however, all the fixtures and fittings are very old that you suspect the hotel has ever done any upgrade since its establishment 2. There is very strong smell of "artificial fragrances" throughout the public areas and elevators of the hotel 3. A small cockroach is found inside the room when we wake up in the morning 4. Internet access is equipped but you need to buy a HKD150 one-day access card. However, the card is out of stock when we want to buy one at the reception. Nothing can be done because it's out of office hour by that time. We end up to go somewhere outside the hotel to get internet access as we have a business conference the other morning at 8:30am! 5. I really want to say some good things about this hotel as it's sad to see a used-to-be international airport hotel to go far below the market standard. However, I can find nothing to praise......maybe the hotel staff there are still friendly. Management of the Regal Hotel Group should think about this as it's not fair for their staff. To them, the product itself is fatal, no matter how friendly they are, the customer expectation still won't be matched.
